name: Tomato Blight
symptoms: Brown spots on leaves, white mold under leaves in humid conditions, rapid wilting
prevention: Rotate crops, ensure good air circulation, water at base of plants, use resistant varieties
treatment: Remove affected plants, apply copper-based fungicides, use baking soda spray
info: Thrives in warm, humid conditions. Can destroy entire crops if not controlled.

name: Powdery Mildew
symptoms: White powdery spots on leaves and stems, yellowing leaves, distorted growth
prevention: Plant resistant varieties, space plants properly, avoid overhead watering
treatment: Apply sulfur or potassium bicarbonate-based fungicides, milk spray solution
info: Common in warm, dry climates with high humidity levels at night.

name: Root Rot
symptoms: Wilting, yellowing leaves, brown mushy roots, stunted growth
prevention: Improve soil drainage, avoid overwatering, rotate crops, use clean equipment
treatment: Remove affected plants, apply fungicide to soil, improve drainage
info: Caused by various soil-borne fungi. Often fatal to plants if not addressed early.

name: Leaf Spot
symptoms: Circular brown spots with yellow halos on leaves, premature leaf drop
prevention: Water in morning, space plants adequately, remove plant debris, rotate crops
treatment: Apply copper fungicide, remove severely infected leaves, use baking soda spray
info: Spread by water splash. Can significantly reduce yield if left untreated.

name: Corn Smut
symptoms: Swollen, distorted kernels with black powdery spores, galls on ears
prevention: Plant resistant varieties, avoid wounding plants, rotate crops
treatment: Remove and destroy infected ears before spores rupture, fungicide application
info: Considered a delicacy in some cultures (huitlacoche).

name: Rice Blast
symptoms: Diamond-shaped lesions on leaves, collar rot, node rot, panicle blight
prevention: Use resistant varieties, avoid excess nitrogen, maintain proper water levels
treatment: Apply fungicides like tricyclazole, proper field sanitation
info: One of the most destructive diseases of rice worldwide.

name: Late Blight
symptoms: Dark green to black water-soaked lesions on leaves, grayish-white mold on undersides, tuber rot
prevention: Plant certified seed, rotate crops, avoid overhead irrigation
treatment: Apply systemic fungicides like metalaxyl, remove infected plants
info: Famously caused the Irish Potato Famine in the 19th century.

name: Downy Mildew
symptoms: Yellow patches on leaves, white to grayish mold underside, leaf curling
prevention: Plant resistant varieties, maintain air flow, avoid excess moisture
treatment: Use copper fungicide sprays, practice crop rotation
info: Different from powdery mildew, thrives in cool and wet conditions.

name: Anthracnose
symptoms: Sunken dark lesions on stems, pods, fruits, black spots on leaves
prevention: Use disease-free seeds, rotate crops, avoid wet foliage
treatment: Apply chlorothalonil fungicide, remove diseased plant parts
info: Highly destructive to tropical fruits like mangoes.

name: Bacterial Wilt
symptoms: Sudden wilting of leaves despite moist soil, brown vascular tissues
prevention: Use resistant varieties, control insect vectors, sanitize tools
treatment: No effective cure, rogue out infected plants, crop rotation
info: Caused by Ralstonia solanacearum bacteria, spreads rapidly.

name: Black Sigatoka
symptoms: Streaks on leaves turning dark brown, reduced photosynthesis, premature fruit ripening
prevention: Ensure good drainage, remove infected leaves, plant resistant cultivars
treatment: Apply systemic fungicides like triazoles, maintain field hygiene
info: Major global threat to banana production.

name: Clubroot
symptoms: Swollen, distorted roots, wilting, yellow leaves
prevention: Maintain soil pH above 7.2, rotate crops for 7 years, use lime
treatment: No direct cure, soil amendments and resistant cultivars help
info: Caused by Plasmodiophora brassicae, persists in soil for years.

name: Goss's Wilt
symptoms: Water-soaked lesions with shiny freckles, leaf blight, stalk rot
prevention: Rotate crops, bury plant residue, plant resistant hybrids
treatment: No chemical cure, manage with cultural practices
info: Caused by Clavibacter michiganensis subspecies, spreads via residue.

name: Ergot
symptoms: Purple-black fungal sclerotia replacing grain kernels
prevention: Use clean seed, deep plow, rotate crops
treatment: Fungicides at flowering stage, crop sanitation
info: Produces toxic alkaloids that can cause ergotism in humans and animals.

name: Panama Disease
symptoms: Yellowing of lower leaves, wilting, vascular discoloration
prevention: Use resistant varieties, improve drainage, avoid infected soil
treatment: No cure, remove infected plants, soil sterilization
info: A major fungal disease threatening Cavendish bananas worldwide.

name: Fire Blight
symptoms: Shoots wilt, turn brown or black, appear scorched, oozing bacterial exudate
prevention: Prune infected branches, disinfect tools, avoid high nitrogen fertilizers
treatment: Apply streptomycin sprays, copper fungicides
info: Caused by Erwinia amylovora bacteria, spreads quickly in orchards.

name: Gray Mold (Botrytis)
symptoms: Gray fuzzy mold on fruit and leaves, fruit rot, flower blight
prevention: Avoid overhead watering, improve air circulation, remove infected fruits
treatment: Fungicides like iprodione, sulfur sprays
info: Thrives in cool, damp weather; very common post-harvest.

name: Citrus Canker
symptoms: Raised corky lesions on leaves, stems, and fruits, premature fruit drop
prevention: Plant resistant varieties, quarantine infected orchards
treatment: Copper-based sprays, remove infected trees
info: Bacterial disease that can devastate citrus production.

name: Rust
symptoms: Orange, brown, or yellow pustules on leaves, reduced vigor
prevention: Plant resistant varieties, destroy alternate host plants
treatment: Fungicide sprays like triazoles, sulfur-based fungicides
info: Includes wheat stem rust and coffee rust, historically destructive.

name: Wilt (Fusarium)
symptoms: Yellowing, wilting, vascular streaks in stems, plant collapse
prevention: Use resistant cultivars, solarize soil, crop rotation
treatment: Soil fumigation, fungicides offer limited control
info: Soil-borne fungus that can survive for years without a host.

name: Alternaria Leaf Spot
symptoms: Dark concentric rings on leaves, yellow halos, premature defoliation
prevention: Crop rotation, remove plant debris, avoid wet foliage
treatment: Apply mancozeb or chlorothalonil fungicides
info: Can significantly reduce yield in carrots and cabbages.

name: Sclerotinia Stem Rot (White Mold)
symptoms: White fluffy growth on stems, black sclerotia inside tissues, wilting
prevention: Improve air flow, rotate crops, avoid excessive irrigation
treatment: Apply boscalid fungicide, use resistant varieties
info: Affects over 400 plant species, very destructive in beans and oil crops.

name: Mosaic Virus
symptoms: Mottled light and dark green patterns on leaves, stunted growth
prevention: Use virus-free seeds, control insect vectors, resistant varieties
treatment: No cure, rogue infected plants, control aphids
info: Includes famous Tobacco Mosaic Virus (TMV), one of the first viruses discovered.

name: Angular Leaf Spot
symptoms: Angular water-soaked lesions on leaves, turning brown and papery
prevention: Avoid overhead irrigation, rotate crops, resistant cultivars
treatment: Apply copper sprays, remove infected debris
info: Bacterial disease that thrives in wet and warm weather.

name: Phytophthora Blight
symptoms: Dark water-soaked stem lesions, fruit rot, leaf wilt
prevention: Improve drainage, rotate crops, resistant hybrids
treatment: Fungicides like mefenoxam, destroy infected plants
info: Caused by Phytophthora capsici, survives long in soil.

name: Crown Gall
symptoms: Large rough galls at crown or roots, stunted growth, reduced yield
prevention: Avoid mechanical injury, use disease-free stock
treatment: No chemical cure, remove infected plants, biological control with Agrobacterium radiobacter
info: Caused by Agrobacterium tumefaciens, also used in genetic engineering.
